From Earth to Heaven [Attack Technique].effect: You fly your speed + 2. You gain a power bonus to all defenses equal to your Wisdom modifier during this movement. If you don’t land at the end of this movement, you fall.

Part the Seas [Attack Technique].name: Part the Seas [Attack Technique]
Part the Seas [Attack Technique].flavor: Foes that try to stop you are knocked aside as you surge through combat, ready to unleash a blow that stuns an enemy in its tracks.
Part the Seas [Attack Technique].onHit: 1d12 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is stunned until the end of your next turn.
Part the Seas [Attack Technique].ironSoul: If you make the attack using a mace or a staff, the target also falls prone.
Part the Seas [Attack Technique].effect: You move your speed + 6. Any enemy that misses you with an opportunity attack provoked by this movement takes damage equal to your Constitution modifier and falls prone.

Shatter the Mountain [Attack Technique].name: Shatter the Mountain [Attack Technique]
Shatter the Mountain [Attack Technique].flavor: An unshakeable concentration girds your body as your rockshattering strike overwhelms a foe.
Shatter the Mountain [Attack Technique].onHit: 3d12 + Dexterity modifier damage, and you push the target a number of squares equal to 3 + your Strength modifier. If this attack bloodies the target, it takes 1d12 extra damage. If the target is an unattended object, this attack deals 2d12 extra damage.
Shatter the Mountain [Attack Technique].effect: You shift 4 squares and gain resist 5 to all damage until the end of your next turn.

Weight of the Anchor [Attack Technique].name: Weight of the Anchor [Attack Technique]
Weight of the Anchor [Attack Technique].flavor: Your attack hits with the force of iron, pinning an enemy in place as you race across the battlefield.
Weight of the Anchor [Attack Technique].ironSoul: If you make the attack using a light blade or a spear, you gain a +2 power bonus to the attack roll.
Weight of the Anchor [Attack Technique].onHit: 4d8 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.

Adamantine Hurricane.name: Adamantine Hurricane
Adamantine Hurricane.flavor: You are a blur as you move and attack, laying into foes around you with a destructive force equal to that of the mightiest weapons.
Adamantine Hurricane.effect: You move your speed + 2. Any enemy that misses you with an opportunity attack provoked by this movement takes 10 damage and falls prone. Make a secondary attack that is a close burst 1.
Adamantine Hurricane.primaryTarget: Each enemy you can see in the burst
Adamantine Hurricane.onHit: 2d10 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the primary target takes ongoing 10 damage (save ends). If the primary target is already taking ongoing damage, that ongoing damage increases by 10.
Adamantine Hurricane.secondaryTarget: Each enemy you can see in the burst other than the primary targets
Adamantine Hurricane.secondaryOnHit: 2d10 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the secondary target takes ongoing 10 damage (save ends). If the secondary target is already taking ongoing damage, that ongoing damage increases by 10.

Falling Star Strike.name: Falling Star Strike
Falling Star Strike.flavor: You streak into the air, trailing fire and light. When you land, the impact staggers, blinds, and burns your foes.
keywords: Fire, Implement, Psionic, Radiant, Teleportation, Thunder, Zone
Falling Star Strike.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any creature that ends its turn within the zone takes fire damage equal to your Dexterity modifier.
Falling Star Strike.onHit: 3d10 + Dexterity modifier fire, radiant, and thunder damage, and the target is blinded (save ends).

Titan's Mighty Grasp.name: Titan's Mighty Grasp
Titan's Mighty Grasp.flavor: You rock your enemy with a devastating attack, then wrap it in a steely, unbreakable embrace.
Titan's Mighty Grasp.onHit: 5d12 + Dexterity modifier damage, and you grab the target. The target takes a penalty to checks to escape the grab equal to your Strength modifier.
Titan's Mighty Grasp.onMiss: Half damage, and you grab the target
Titan's Mighty Grasp.effect: Until the grab ends, you can use the Titan's Mighty Grasp Attack power against the target.
Titan's Mighty Grasp.requirement: The power Titan's Mighty Grasp must be active in order to use this power.
Titan's Mighty Grasp.secondaryOnHit: 3d10 + Strength modifier damage. The target cannot attempt to escape the grab until the start of your next turn.

Deflect Arrow.name: Deflect Arrow
Deflect Arrow.flavor: Your foe manages to strike you from afar, so you focus your energy and spin away from further attacks.
Deflect Arrow.trigger: You are hit by a ranged weapon attack.
Deflect Arrow.effect: Until the start of your next turn, you gain superior cover against ranged weapon attacks, and you can shift 1 square as a free action each time a ranged weapon attack misses you.

Wind Through the Willows [Attack Techniq.name: Wind Through the Willows [Attack Technique]
Wind Through the Willows [Attack Techniq.flavor: You move like a furious wind through the line of your enemies, hobbling them.
Wind Through the Willows [Attack Techniq.onHit: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is slowed and cannot charge until the end of your next turn.
Wind Through the Willows [Attack Techniq.effect: You shift 1 square and slide the target 1 square, swapping places.

Water Gives Way.name: Water Gives Way
Water Gives Way.flavor: Like a stone passing harmlessly through water, so do your enemies’ attacks pass by you.
Water Gives Way.trigger: An adjacent enemy hits you with a melee attack.
Water Gives Way.attack: Dexterity vs. Fortitude. If the triggering attack is a charge, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll and deal 1d10 extra damage if you hit.
Water Gives Way.onHit: 3d10 + Dexterity modifier damage, and you slide the target up to 2 squares and knock it prone.
Water Gives Way.onMiss: You regain the use of this power but cannot use it again during this encounter.

Brilliant Counterstrike [Attack Techniqu.name: Brilliant Counterstrike [Attack Technique]
Brilliant Counterstrike [Attack Techniqu.flavor: You ready yourself for the blows of your enemies and prepare a sudden counterattack.
Brilliant Counterstrike [Attack Techniqu.onHit: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier damage. Immediately after any adjacent enemy attacks you before the start of your next turn, you can deal 1d8 damage to that enemy as a free action.
Brilliant Counterstrike [Attack Techniqu.effect: Choose either to escape from a grab automatically or to end one mark on yourself. You then shift up to 2 squares.

Stone Warrior Training.name: Stone Warrior Training
Stone Warrior Training.flavor: In a peaceful moment, you give your ally a brief lesson in the ways of your style so that he or she can draw upon your strength by imitating your actions.
Stone Warrior Training.requirement: You must have just ended a short or an extended rest.
Stone Warrior Training.target: One ally who can see or hear you
Stone Warrior Training.effect: Until the start of your next rest, whenever you hit an enemy with an attack, the target’s next attack against that enemy gains a power bonus to the damage roll equal to your Strength modifier.

Desert Wind Flurry of Blows.name: Desert Wind Flurry of Blows
Desert Wind Flurry of Blows.flavor: A successful attack ignites your mind’s power, causing lambent flames to dance across your body and sear your enemies.
Desert Wind Flurry of Blows.trigger: You hit with an attack during your turn.
Desert Wind Flurry of Blows.target:
One creature
    Level 11: One or two creatures
    Level 21: Each enemy adjacent to you
Desert Wind Flurry of Blows.effect: The target takes 2 + your Charisma modifier fire damage. If the target wasn’t targeted by the triggering attack, it also takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls for any attack that includes you as a target until the end of your next turn. You can then shift 1 square.
Desert Wind Flurry of Blows.special: You can use this power only once per round.

Eternal Tide Flurry of Blows.name: Eternal Tide Flurry of Blows
Eternal Tide Flurry of Blows.flavor: You unleash psionic energy in the wake of your initial attack to wrench another enemy into your reach.
Eternal Tide Flurry of Blows.trigger: You hit with an attack during your turn.
Eternal Tide Flurry of Blows.target:
One creature
    Level 11: One or two creatures
    Level 21: One, two, or three creatures
Eternal Tide Flurry of Blows.effect: The target takes damage equal to your Strength modifier, and you can pull the target 1 square. If the target wasn’t targeted by the triggering attack, it is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Eternal Tide Flurry of Blows.special: You can use this power only once per round.

Blistering Flourish [Attack Technique].name: Blistering Flourish [Attack Technique]
Blistering Flourish [Attack Technique].flavor: Executing movements in a complex pattern brings forth elemental fire to aid the next attack you make.
keywords: Elemental, Fire, Full Discipline, Implement, Psionic
Blistering Flourish [Attack Technique].onHit:
1d8 + Dexterity modifier damage. Until the end of your next turn, your melee attacks deal extra fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier.
    Level 21: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier damage.
Blistering Flourish [Attack Technique].effect: You move up to your speed. Enemies that hit you with opportunity attacks provoked by this movement take fire damage equal to 2 + your Charisma modifier.

Crashing Wave [Attack Technique].name: Crashing Wave [Attack Technique]
Crashing Wave [Attack Technique].flavor: Surging forward through your enemies’ ranks, you deliver a resounding strike to send an enemy reeling.
Crashing Wave [Attack Technique].onHit:
1d8 + Dexterity modifier damage, and you can slide the target 1 square.
    Level 21: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier damage.
Crashing Wave [Attack Technique].effect: You shift up to a number of squares equal to half your Strength modifier. You can shift through enemies’ spaces during this move.

Balance Restored [Attack Technique].name: Balance Restored [Attack Technique]
Balance Restored [Attack Technique].flavor: Dropping into a wide stance helps you deliver the greatest impact, while also ensuring that you can deal with any counterattacks that follow.
Balance Restored [Attack Technique].onHit: 1d10 + Dexterity modifier damage, and you push the target up to a number of squares equal to half your Strength modifier.
Balance Restored [Attack Technique].effect: You shift 1 square. The next time an adjacent enemy hits you before the start of your next turn, you can knock that enemy prone after the attack is resolved.

Call up the Savage Wind [Attack Techniqu.name: Call up the Savage Wind [Attack Technique]
Call up the Savage Wind [Attack Techniqu.flavor: A stiff gust rises up to scatter your enemies and speed you over treacherous terrain.
Call up the Savage Wind [Attack Techniqu.effect: You move up to your speed, ignoring difficult terrain.

Light the Fire [Attack Technique].name: Light the Fire [Attack Technique]
Light the Fire [Attack Technique].flavor: Bright flames dance across your body, scorching enemies you strike and swirling around you to immolate foes in your reach.
keywords: Aura, Elemental, Fire, Full Discipline, Implement, Psionic

Cyclone Scourge.name: Cyclone Scourge
Cyclone Scourge.flavor: You leap into the air, gathering up winds to help you smash your enemy and trap it in a swirling column of destruction.
Cyclone Scourge.effect: The blast creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. You can move the zone up to 3 squares as a move action. Once per turn, when a creature other than you enters the zone or ends its turn there, you can slide that creature up to 2 squares as a free action.
Cyclone Scourge.onHit: 2d6 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).
Cyclone Scourge.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.

Reflection in Water.name: Reflection in Water
Reflection in Water.flavor: Fixing your attention on a single opponent lets you mirror its movements with swift strikes and counterstrikes.
Reflection in Water.effect: You assume the reflection in water stance. Until the stance ends, you gain combat advantage against any enemy adjacent to at least one of your allies. Also, when an enemy adjacent to you misses you with an attack, you can use an immediate reaction to swap places with it (the enemy slides 1 square, and you shift 1 square).

Risen Sun.name: Risen Sun
Risen Sun.flavor: Your wrath ignites your thoughts and causes them to erupt into liquid flames that rush out and incinerate anything near you.
Risen Sun.onHit: 2d6 + Dexterity modifier damage, and ongoing 5 fire damage (save ends).
Risen Sun.eachFailedSavingThrow: You can slide the target 1 square as a free action.
Risen Sun.effect: You activate an aura 1 that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any enemy that enters the aura or ends its turn there takes fire damage equal to your Dexterity modifier. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Cat and Mouse.name: Cat and Mouse
Cat and Mouse.flavor: You step into your enemy’s blind spot after a successful attack and leave it casting about to find you.
Cat and Mouse.trigger: You hit an enemy with a melee attack.
Cat and Mouse.effect: You shift up to 3 squares to a square adjacent to the enemy. Until the start of your next turn or until you take damage from an attack, you have total concealment against that enemy.

Eye in the Sky.name: Eye in the Sky
Eye in the Sky.flavor: You attune your mind to the dangers at hand, and when an enemy closes, you step out of its reach.
Eye in the Sky.effect: You can shift 1 square to a square adjacent to the triggering enemy. You gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against that enemy’s attacks until the end of this turn.
Eye in the Sky.requirement: The power Eye in the Sky must be active in order to use this power.
Eye in the Sky.trigger: An enemy enters a square adjacent to you.

Reed in the Wind.name: Reed in the Wind
Reed in the Wind.flavor: You spin away from the attack, only to snap back with a quick threat of your own.
Reed in the Wind.effect: You gain temporary hit points equal to your Dexterity modifier, and you gain combat advantage against the triggering enemy until the end of your next turn.

Bonecrusher [Attack Technique].name: Bonecrusher [Attack Technique]
Bonecrusher [Attack Technique].flavor: A sickening crunch sounds from your opponent when you land your strike. Its pain bolsters your confidence to keep fighting.
Bonecrusher [Attack Technique].onHit: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to all defenses until the end of your next turn.
Bonecrusher [Attack Technique].effect: You shift 1 square. Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to AC and Fortitude.

Burning Brand [Attack Technique].name: Burning Brand [Attack Technique]
Burning Brand [Attack Technique].flavor: Your strike leaves behind a fiery imprint that explodes the next time the target is struck. Wielding fire in this way wreathes you in concealing smoke.
keywords: Elemental, Fire, Full Discipline, Implement, Psionic
Burning Brand [Attack Technique].onHit: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier damage. The first time the target takes damage from an attack before the start of your next turn, the target and each of your enemies adjacent to it take fire damage equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier.
Burning Brand [Attack Technique].effect: You move up to your speed + 2. You have partial concealment during this movement.

Frozen Moment [Attack Technique].name: Frozen Moment [Attack Technique]
Frozen Moment [Attack Technique].flavor: Your strike pins down your enemy, forcing it to face you.
keywords: Cold, Elemental, Full Discipline, Implement, Psionic
Frozen Moment [Attack Technique].onHit: 2d6 + Dexterity modifier cold damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Frozen Moment [Attack Technique].effect: Until the start of your next turn, you are immobilized and gain resistance to all damage equal to 3 + your Strength modifier.

Calm Before the Storm.name: Calm Before the Storm
Calm Before the Storm.flavor: You feel calm settle over you, and you see your situation with new eyes. Reading your enemies’ thoughts helps you strike before their own attacks can land.
Calm Before the Storm.onHit: 1d8 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target falls prone.
Calm Before the Storm.onMiss: You grant combat advantage to the target until the start of your next turn.
Calm Before the Storm.effect: You enter the calm before the storm stance. Until the stance ends, you are slowed, and you can use the secondary power at will.
Calm Before the Storm.requirement: The power Calm before the Storm must be active in order to use this power.
Calm Before the Storm.trigger: An enemy adjacent to you makes an attack.

Overwhelming Mountain Strike.name: Overwhelming Mountain Strike
Overwhelming Mountain Strike.flavor: Your strike against a pressure point robs your enemy of its ability to maneuver effectively. Until it recovers, you keep it pinned down.
Overwhelming Mountain Strike.onHit: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).
Overwhelming Mountain Strike.aftereffect: The target is slowed until the end of its next turn.
Overwhelming Mountain Strike.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Salamander Charge.name: Salamander Charge
Salamander Charge.flavor: Your motions gather elemental fire, and you leave a fiery trail behind you as you close in to destroy your opponent.
Salamander Charge.effect:
You move up to your speed. The squares you leave become a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any creature that enters the zone or starts its turn there takes fire damage equal to your Dexterity modifier. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.
    At the end of the move, make the following attack.

Break the Dam.name: Break the Dam
Break the Dam.flavor: You use the pain of an enemy’s blow to draw more deeply from your psionic reservoir and quit your position for a safer one.
Break the Dam.trigger: An enemy hits you with an attack.
Break the Dam.effect: You shift up to half your speed.

Fresh Start.name: Fresh Start
Fresh Start.flavor: All in a whisper of time, you call upon your mental reserves to invigorate you while willing yourself to dart to a better location.
Fresh Start.effect: You can spend a healing surge, and then shift up to 2 squares.

Roll the Boulder.name: Roll the Boulder
Roll the Boulder.flavor: To your enemies, you seem to swell in size and stature, your body made more formidable by your mind’s strength.
Roll the Boulder.effect: You enter the roll the boulder stance. Until the stance ends, you gain a +2 power bonus to the distance of your pushes, pulls, and slides, and you gain a +4 power bonus to Strength checks and Strength-based skill checks.

Deafening Howl [Attack Technique].name: Deafening Howl [Attack Technique]
Deafening Howl [Attack Technique].flavor: You vault into the air, soaring over your enemies to land in their midst and roar in defiance.
keywords: Elemental, Full Discipline, Implement, Psionic, Thunder
Deafening Howl [Attack Technique].effect: You fly up to your speed.

Fiery Serpent [Attack Technique].name: Fiery Serpent [Attack Technique]
Fiery Serpent [Attack Technique].flavor: A snaking flame extends from your hand and snaps through the air to strike a distant opponent. The flames you call forth linger, adding their power to your next fire attack.
keywords: Elemental, Fire, Full Discipline, Implement, Psionic
Fiery Serpent [Attack Technique].onMiss: One enemy within 5 squares of you other than the target takes 1d8 fire damage.
Fiery Serpent [Attack Technique].effect: You shift up to half your speed. Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to fire damage rolls.

Giant’s Grasp [Attack Technique].name: Giant’s Grasp [Attack Technique]
Giant’s Grasp [Attack Technique].flavor: You snap your hand out to grab your foe. As you tighten your grip, the enemy howls in pain.
Giant’s Grasp [Attack Technique].requirement: You must have at least one hand free.
Giant’s Grasp [Attack Technique].onHit: 2d6 + Dexterity modifier damage, and you grab the target. Until the end of your next turn, the target takes a penalty to escape attempts equal to your Strength modifier.
Giant’s Grasp [Attack Technique].effect: You move up to your speed. If you are grabbing a creature, the creature moves with you. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks from creatures you have grabbed.

Lightning Leap.name: Lightning Leap
Lightning Leap.flavor: The lightning that scorches your enemies also speeds you away, and thunder offers a cacophonous accompaniment.
Lightning Leap.effect: You jump up to 5 squares without provoking opportunity attacks. Then make the secondary attack.

Stone Juggernaut.name: Stone Juggernaut
Stone Juggernaut.flavor: Attuning your mind to elemental earth triggers your transformation into a stone juggernaut. Your every strike causes the earth to fracture and enemies to fall.
Stone Juggernaut.effect: You assume the form of the stone juggernaut until the end of the encounter. While in this form, you have a +2 power bonus to all defenses and can make saving throws against slowing, immobilizing, or restraining effects at the start of your turn as well as the end of your turn. The form also enables you to ignore difficult terrain and use the secondary power at will.
Stone Juggernaut.requirement: The power Stone Juggernaut must be active in order to use this power.
Stone Juggernaut.onHit: 2d6 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target falls prone.

Tsunami Throw.name: Tsunami Throw
Tsunami Throw.flavor: You catch one opponent and hurl it away from you with a wave of mental force, sending it crashing into your other enemies.
Tsunami Throw.trigger: An adjacent enemy hits you with an attack.
Tsunami Throw.effect: You push the primary target up to 5 squares, knock it prone, and then make the secondary attack.
Tsunami Throw.secondaryTarget: Each creature other than the primary target in the burst
Tsunami Throw.secondaryOnHit: 1d8 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the secondary target falls prone.

Elemental Resilience.name: Elemental Resilience
Elemental Resilience.flavor: Your reactions are faster than the energy being brought to bear against you. You instantly adjust your body to minimize the effect of all such attacks that target you.
Elemental Resilience.trigger: You take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage.
Elemental Resilience.effect: You gain resist 5 to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn.
Elemental Resilience.aftereffect: You gain resist 3 to the triggering damage type until the end of the encounter.

Flame’s Blessing.name: Flame’s Blessing
Flame’s Blessing.flavor: The pale flames dancing across your body do not harm you, but instead turn you into a faster and more accurate attacker.
Flame’s Blessing.effect: You assume the flame’s blessing stance. Until the stance ends, you gain a +2 power bonus to speed and a +1 power bonus to fire attack rolls.

Mirrored Pursuit.name: Mirrored Pursuit
Mirrored Pursuit.flavor: You match your enemy’s movements as if you were a reflection in a still pool.
Mirrored Pursuit.trigger: The marked enemy moves willingly on its turn.
Mirrored Pursuit.effect: You shift up to your speed, and you must end this shift adjacent to the enemy. You don’t get your normal move action on your next turn.
Mirrored Pursuit.requirement: The power Mirrored Pursuit must be active in order to use this power.

Break the Stone [Attack Technique].name: Break the Stone [Attack Technique]
Break the Stone [Attack Technique].flavor: The ground trembles as you step forward to smash your foe. So great is the concussion that your opponent finds itself disoriented and vulnerable.
Break the Stone [Attack Technique].onHit: 2d10 + Dexterity modifier damage. Until the end of your next turn, the target is slowed and has vulnerability to all damage equal to your Strength modifier.
Break the Stone [Attack Technique].effect: You shift up to 2 squares. Until the start of your next turn, you gain resistance to all damage equal to 3 + your Strength modifier, and you cannot be subjected to forced movement unless you choose to be.

Skirling Grasp [Attack Technique].name: Skirling Grasp [Attack Technique]
Skirling Grasp [Attack Technique].flavor: A mighty wind howls around you, punishing your foes and giving you incredible mobility.
Skirling Grasp [Attack Technique].onHit: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier damage and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Skirling Grasp [Attack Technique].effect: You move up to your speed + 2, ignoring difficult terrain.

Stoke the Flames [Attack Technique].name: Stoke the Flames [Attack Technique]
Stoke the Flames [Attack Technique].flavor: Calling on a great quantity of elemental fire to aid your attacks causes you to emanate hungry flames that scorch anything in their path.
keywords: Aura, Elemental, Fire, Full Discipline, Implement, Psionic

Breath of the Storm Lord.name: Breath of the Storm Lord
Breath of the Storm Lord.flavor: You execute a series of kicks and thrusts that calls forth a column of storm clouds to hamper and brutalize your foe.
Breath of the Storm Lord.onHit: 3d8 + Dexterity modifier thunder damage, and the target is slowed (save ends).
Breath of the Storm Lord.effect: You shift up to 4 squares to a square adjacent to the blast. The blast then creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is difficult terrain for creatures other than you, and any creature other than you that ends its turn in the zone falls prone. You can move the zone up to 3 squares as a move action.
Breath of the Storm Lord.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.

Dragon’s Flame.name: Dragon’s Flame
Dragon’s Flame.flavor: You surge through your enemies’ ranks with a flurry of blazing attacks, and as your strikes fall, fire radiates out from you.
keywords: Aura, Elemental, Fire, Implement, Psionic, Psychic
Dragon’s Flame.onHit: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier fire and psychic damage, and ongoing 10 fire and psychic damage (save ends).
Dragon’s Flame.eachFailedSavingThrow: You can slide the target up to 2 squares as a free action.
Dragon’s Flame.effect: You activate an aura 1 that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any enemy that enters the aura or ends its turn there takes fire and psychic damage equal to your Dexterity modifier. An enemy can take this damage only once per turn.

Sundered Mountain.name: Sundered Mountain
Sundered Mountain.flavor: A cracking noise sounds when you strike your foe, and the creature’s staggering, pain-wracked steps are evidence of the extent of its injuries.
Sundered Mountain.effect: The target is subjected to sundering (save ends). Until this effect ends, the target takes 5 damage for each square it willingly enters. If the target moves more than half its speed willingly, it falls prone at the end of its movement. While you are adjacent to the target, it cannot make saving throws to end this effect.

Catch the Wind.name: Catch the Wind
Catch the Wind.flavor: Spinning away from an enemy’s missile sends you on a giant leap through the air that brings you close to your attacker.
Catch the Wind.trigger: An enemy within 10 squares of you damages you with a ranged or an area attack.
Catch the Wind.effect: You take only half damage from the attack. After the attack is resolved, you fly up to 10 squares to a square adjacent to the triggering enemy.

One Hundred Steps.name: One Hundred Steps
One Hundred Steps.flavor: You attune your mind to concentrate on keeping yourself safe, and you can effortlessly flit away from any attack mounted against you.
One Hundred Steps.requirement: The power One Hundred Steps must be active in order to use this power.

Roots of the Mountain.name: Roots of the Mountain
Roots of the Mountain.flavor: Rooting yourself in place helps you deflect an enemy’s attack and knock the foe out of your way.
Roots of the Mountain.trigger: An adjacent enemy attacks your AC or Fortitude.
Roots of the Mountain.effect: You gain a +4 power bonus to AC and Fortitude until the start of your next turn. If the triggering attack misses, you can push the triggering enemy up to 2 squares.

Bitter Stasis [Attack Technique].name: Bitter Stasis [Attack Technique]
Bitter Stasis [Attack Technique].flavor: The elemental cold released through your attack traps you and an enemy in ice. The cold is more than your enemy can bear, but it offers you protection from outside interference.
keywords: Cold, Elemental, Full Discipline, Implement, Psionic
Bitter Stasis [Attack Technique].onHit: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier cold damage, and the target is restrained until the end of your next turn.
Bitter Stasis [Attack Technique].effect: Until the end of your next turn, you are immobilized, you are immune to forced movement, and you gain resistance to all damage equal to 5 + your Strength modifier.

Fist of the Whirling Tempest [Attack Tec.name: Fist of the Whirling Tempest [Attack Technique]
Fist of the Whirling Tempest [Attack Tec.flavor: You reach out with your thoughts to the sky and call down a thunderbolt to destroy your enemies. Echoing thunder follows you as you maneuver into position.
keywords: Aura, Elemental, Full Discipline, Implement, Lightning, Psionic, Thunder
Fist of the Whirling Tempest [Attack Tec.onHit: 3d6 + Dexterity modifier lightning damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.
Fist of the Whirling Tempest [Attack Tec.effect: You shift up to your speed.

Living Torch [Attack Technique].name: Living Torch [Attack Technique]
Living Torch [Attack Technique].flavor: Black smoke roils around you, obscuring you from sight. When you strike a foe, heat shimmers appear and explode with renewed flames each time your target sustains further injury.
keywords: Elemental, Fire, Full Discipline, Implement, Psionic
Living Torch [Attack Technique].effect: You move up to your speed + 2. During this movement, you have total concealment.

Duel of Fates.name: Duel of Fates
Duel of Fates.flavor: You zero in on an enemy and commit yourself to its defeat by creating a field to keep it close and hedge out interference.
Duel of Fates.onHit: 4d8 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target grants combat advantage (save ends).
Duel of Fates.effect: The squares adjacent to the burst become a zone that lasts until the target drops to 0 hit points or until you leave the zone. Nothing can teleport into or out of the area enclosed by the zone. The target treats the zone as blocking terrain, and any creature other than you or the target that enters the zone or starts its turn there takes 10 psychic damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Fire-Snake Dance.name: Fire-Snake Dance
Fire-Snake Dance.flavor: The fires erupting from your body burn so brightly that none dare stop you. As you move across the battlefield, you deliver strikes that constrict your enemies with coils of flame.
Fire-Snake Dance.effect: You shift up to your speed + 4. You make the following attack each time you first enter a square adjacent to an enemy during this movement. You can attack a given enemy only once with each use of this power.
Fire-Snake Dance.onHit: 3d6 + Dexterity modifier fire damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Fire-Snake Dance.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Neutralizing Strike.name: Neutralizing Strike
Neutralizing Strike.flavor: The disruptive force of your mentally enhanced strike renders your target virtually helpless and ready to be finished off.
Neutralizing Strike.onHit: 3d8 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is stunned until the end of your next turn.
Neutralizing Strike.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is weakened until the end of your next turn.

Everywhere at Once.name: Everywhere at Once
Everywhere at Once.flavor: Your enlightened mind collapses all points in an area to one, so you can be wherever you wish.
Everywhere at Once.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. Any enemy that starts its turn in the zone grants combat advantage to you until the start of its next turn. In addition, whenever an enemy misses you with an attack while you are in the zone, you can teleport to another square in the zone as an immediate reaction.

Hastened Effort.name: Hastened Effort
Hastened Effort.flavor: Psionic energy rushes through you, helping you to do more than what should be possible.
Hastened Effort.effect: You shift up to 2 squares and take a standard action. You cannot use this action to make an attack.

Perfect Motion.name: Perfect Motion
Perfect Motion.flavor: Expanding your mind lets you see pathways across the battlefield that you can exploit to move with impunity.
Perfect Motion.effect: You assume the perfect motion stance. Until the stance ends, your movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

Blazing Scourge [Attack Technique].name: Blazing Scourge [Attack Technique]
Blazing Scourge [Attack Technique].flavor: Hot tendrils unfurl from your outstretched hand to ensnare your foes. The fire you command makes enemies think twice about stopping you and adds intensity to your other fire attacks.
keywords: Elemental, Fire, Full Discipline, Implement, Psionic
Blazing Scourge [Attack Technique].onHit: 3d8 + Dexterity modifier fire damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Blazing Scourge [Attack Technique].effect: You shift up to your speed. Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +4 power bonus to fire damage rolls.

Lightning in the Clouds [Attack Techniqu.name: Lightning in the Clouds [Attack Technique]
Lightning in the Clouds [Attack Techniqu.flavor: You leap into the air and hurl lightning and thunder against your foes.
keywords: Elemental, Full Discipline, Implement, Lightning, Psionic, Thunder
Lightning in the Clouds [Attack Techniqu.onHit: 3d6 + Dexterity modifier lightning damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.
Lightning in the Clouds [Attack Techniqu.effect: You fly up to your speed + 2. If you do not land at the end of this movement, you hover until the start of your next turn, when you descend without taking falling damage.

Order Unbound [Attack Technique].name: Order Unbound [Attack Technique]
Order Unbound [Attack Technique].flavor: You shed order’s hold on your body and become pure energy, if only for a few moments. Your rapid strikes wreak havoc on your foes.
keywords: Elemental, Full Discipline, Implement, Psionic, Teleportation
Order Unbound [Attack Technique].onHit: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier damage, and you slide the target up to a number of squares equal to 1 + your Strength modifier.
Order Unbound [Attack Technique].effect: You become insubstantial until the start of your next turn and teleport up to a number of squares equal to your speed.

Crushing Anger.name: Crushing Anger
Crushing Anger.flavor: An enemy’s strike awakens dreadful rage in you, which you turn into a mental onslaught that leaves the creature unable to continue facing you.
Crushing Anger.trigger: An adjacent enemy hits you with an attack.
Crushing Anger.effect: The target is subjected to crushing anger (save ends). While the target is within 2 squares of you, it takes a -2 penalty to saving throws to end this effect. Until the effect ends, you can use a minor action once during each of your turns to deal 10 damage to the target and knock it prone.

Enduring Boulder.name: Enduring Boulder
Enduring Boulder.flavor: You become a creature not unlike stone, capable of bringing great physical force to bear and proving almost invulnerable to attacks for a time.
Enduring Boulder.effect: You assume the form of the enduring boulder. While in this form, you gain resist 30 to all damage and a +3 power bonus to melee damage rolls. Each time you are hit by an attack, reduce the resistance by 5. When the resistance drops to 0, the form ends.

Living Lightning.name: Living Lightning
Living Lightning.flavor: Launching yourself at an enemy causes psionic energy to crackle around you so that when you land, you deliver a thunderbolt that can shatter your target’s body and mind.
Living Lightning.effect: Before the attack, you can fly up to your speed. Any creature that hits you with an opportunity attack provoked by this movement takes 10 lightning damage.
Living Lightning.onHit: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier lightning and thunder damage, and the target is stunned until the end of your next turn.
Living Lightning.onMiss: Half damage, and the target loses its standard action on its next turn.

Get Away, Stay Away [Attack Technique].name: Get Away, Stay Away [Attack Technique]
Get Away, Stay Away [Attack Technique].flavor: By waiting until several enemies converge on you, you can drive home to all of them at once the folly of daring to confront you head-on.
Get Away, Stay Away [Attack Technique].onHit: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier damage, and you push the target up to a number of squares equal to your Strength modifier.
Get Away, Stay Away [Attack Technique].effect: You shift up to 2 squares. Until the start of your next turn, when an adjacent enemy damages you with an attack, you can use an immediate reaction to push that enemy up to 3 squares and knock it prone.

Loose the Screaming Gale [Attack Techniq.name: Loose the Screaming Gale [Attack Technique]
Loose the Screaming Gale [Attack Techniq.flavor: An unnatural wind comes to life, following on the heels of your swift attacks and hammering into your foes. The same gale lifts you into the air.
Loose the Screaming Gale [Attack Techniq.onHit: 3d8 + Dexterity modifier damage, you slide the target up to 3 squares, and it is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Loose the Screaming Gale [Attack Techniq.effect: You fly up to a number of squares equal to your speed + 4. If you do not land at the end of this movement, you land safely in the nearest unoccupied square at the start of your next turn.

Wildfire Unleashed [Attack Technique].name: Wildfire Unleashed [Attack Technique]
Wildfire Unleashed [Attack Technique].flavor: Elemental fire crawls up your arms and spreads across your body. Wherever you go, fire follows, and at your command savage heat washes out ahead of you to incinerate your enemies.
keywords: Elemental, Fire, Full Discipline, Implement, Psionic, Zone
Wildfire Unleashed [Attack Technique].effect: You shift up to half your speed. The squares you leave become a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any creature that enters the zone or ends its turn there takes fire damage equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier. A creature can take damage from a zone created by this power only once per turn.

Bones of the Mountain King.name: Bones of the Mountain King
Bones of the Mountain King.flavor: Each foe exposed to your rapid assault finds its mobility suddenly curtailed. The longer you remain at hand to threaten an enemy, the more it suffers.
Bones of the Mountain King.effect: The target is immobilized and takes ongoing 10 damage (save ends both). While you are adjacent to the target, it takes a penalty to saving throws against this effect. The penalty equals half your Dexterity modifier.

Rising Phoenix.name: Rising Phoenix
Rising Phoenix.flavor: Death’s proximity awakens the fires within you, causing them to flow out from you in a blazing torrent to burn your enemies and lift you above the battlefield.
keywords: Aura, Elemental, Fire, Healing, Implement, Psionic
Rising Phoenix.trigger: An attack bloodies you or drops you below 1 hit point.
Rising Phoenix.onHit: 2d8 + Dexterity modifier fire damage, and the target is marked and takes ongoing 10 fire damage (save ends both).
Rising Phoenix.eachFailedSavingThrow: The ongoing fire damage increases by 5.
Rising Phoenix.effect: You can spend a healing surge. Until the end of the encounter, you have a fly speed of 6 (altitude limit 2). You also activate an aura 1 that lasts until the end of the encounter. Any enemy that enters the aura or ends its turn there takes fire damage equal to your Dexterity modifier. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Tormenting Mirage.name: Tormenting Mirage
Tormenting Mirage.flavor: Clouding your enemies’ thoughts with doubt and fear, you use their failures to press your own attacks.
Tormenting Mirage.effect: The target takes psychic damage equal to your Dexterity modifier. You and the target swap positions (it slides 1 square, and you shift 1 square), and you gain combat advantage against it until the end of your next turn.
Tormenting Mirage.requirement: The power Tormenting Mirage must be active in order to use this power.
Tormenting Mirage.trigger: An enemy adjacent to you misses you with an attack.
